summary: The Department of Education's Next Gen program—started in 2017—aims to modernize the Office of Federal Student Aid's technology and operations to improve the experiences of students, parents, and its partners. FSA has 4 of 9 modernization projects remaining—all of which have had delays. And 3 of the 4 don't have set implementation dates—limiting FSA's ability to retire 2 older systems. In addition, FSA's total reported...
title: Information Technology: Education Needs to Address Student Aid Modernization Weaknesses
